noun.description: A metal band, chain, or shackle for fastening someone's hands or ankles.
examples: the practice of keeping prisoners in manacles

verb.description: Fetter (a person or a part of the body) with manacles.
examples: his hands were manacled behind his back

origin: Middle English: from Old French manicle handcuff, from Latin manicula, diminutive of manus hand.
